text: In Greek mythology, Thespia (Ancient Greek: Θέσπια) was the daughter of the river-god, Asopus and Metope, daughter of Ladon, also a river-god. Thespiae (the city west of Thebes) was named after her.Pausanias. Description of Greece 9.26.6 with an English Translation by W.H.S. Jones, Litt.D., and H.A. Ormerod, M.A., in 4 Volumes. Cambridge, MA, Harvard University Press; London, William Heinemann Ltd. 1918. == Pausanias' Account == > "They say that Thespia was a daughter of Asopus, who gave her name to the > city, while others say that Thespius, who was descended from Erechtheus, > came from Athens and was the man after whom the city was called." == References == Category:Children of Asopus Category:Characters in Greek mythology
title: Thespia (mythology)
